full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement: S77 Room B12 PD5, PD2 and PD6 Electrical Panel Replacement**

Reference Number: #cb-6837-90650967
 Solicitation Number: #23-58051
 Published on: June 29, 2023
 Electronic Tenders Due Date: August 1, 2023 (14:00 Eastern Time)

**Project Description:**
The National Research Council Canada, located at 100 Sussex Drive, Ottawa, ON, is soliciting bids for the installation of a new electrical panel system in Building S77, Room B12, featuring PD5, PD2, and PD6 panels.

**Key Requirements:**

*   The successful bidder must attend a mandatory site visit on July 11th or 12th, 2023, at 10:00 am to inspect the project site.
*   Bidders are required to provide a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) from the Canadian Industrial Security Director (CISD) at the point of tender submission or within 48 hours of closing.
*   All subcontractors and personnel working on the project must hold a valid RELIABILITY STATUS from the CISD or other Federal Departments/agencies, along with the names and birthdates or security clearance certificate numbers of all assigned personnel
*   A valid WSIB certificate must be provided with the tender or prior to contract award.

**Security Requirements:**

The project requires a mandatory security requirement, including compliance with the provisions of the Security Requirements Checklist and the Industrial Security Manual.

**Contact Information:**

 Project inquiries and tender documents may be obtained through the Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA services provider.  The Contracting Authority for this project is Collin Long, who can be contacted at:
Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca.  Douglas Juan  Juan was initially not listed as the Tender Champion for this tender; however, there is some information available about Project delivery service provider Sara dussia

**Dispute Resolution:**
All disputes or claims arising from the project will be settled amicably through negotiations or binding arbitration.  Both parties will be required to bear the costs of arbitration and will fully participate in the arbitration process.

If you are a bidder, please contact the Contracting Authority directly for any questions or concerns you may have regarding the project.
